member.name: T:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DateFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies how dates are formatted when writing JSON text.

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DateFormatHandling.IsoDateFormat
member.summary: Dates are written in the ISO 8601 format, e.g. "2012-03-21T05:40Z".

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DateFormatHandling.MicrosoftDateFormat
member.summary: Dates are written in the Microsoft JSON format, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/".

member.name: T:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DateParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DateParseHandling.None
member.summary: Date formatted strings are not parsed to a date type and are read as strings.

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTime
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTimeOffset
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: T:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling
member.summary: Specifies how to treat the time value when converting between string and .

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Local
member.summary: Treat as local time. If the object represents a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), it is converted to the local time.

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Utc
member.summary: Treat as a UTC. If the object represents a local time, it is converted to a UTC.

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Unspecified
member.summary: Treat as a local time if a is being converted to a string. If a string is being converted to , convert to a local time if a time zone is specified.

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.RoundtripKind
member.summary: Time zone information should be preserved when converting.

member.name: T:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DefaultValueHandling
member.summary: Specifies default value handling options for the .

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Include
member.summary: Include members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects. Included members are written to JSON. Has no effect when deserializing.

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects so that is is not written to JSON. This option will ignore all default values (e.g. null for objects and nullable typesl; 0 for integers, decimals and floating point numbers; and false for booleans). The default value ignored can be changed by placing the on the property.

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Populate
member.summary: Members with a default value but no JSON will be set to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.DefaultValueHandling.IgnoreAndPopulate
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects and sets members to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: T:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.FloatFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies float format handling options when writing special floating point numbers, e.g. , and with .

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.FloatFormatHandling.String
member.summary: Write special floating point values as strings in JSON, e.g. "NaN", "Infinity", "-Infinity".

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.FloatFormatHandling.Symbol
member.summary: Write special floating point values as symbols in JSON, e.g. NaN, Infinity, -Infinity. Note that this will produce non-valid JSON.

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.FloatFormatHandling.DefaultValue
member.summary: Write special floating point values as the property's default value in JSON, e.g. 0.0 for a property, null for a property.

member.name: T:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.FloatParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how floating point numbers, e.g. 1.0 and 9.9, are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.FloatParseHandling.Double
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.FloatParseHandling.Decimal
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.Formatting.None
member.summary: No special formatting is applied. This is the default.

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.Formatting.Indented
member.summary: Causes child objects to be indented according to the and settings.

member.summary: All public members are serialized by default. Members can be excluded using or . This is the default member serialization mode.

member.summary: Only members must be marked with or are serialized. This member serialization mode can also be set by marking the class with .

member.name: F:CodeSmith.Engine.Json.MemberSerialization.Fields
member.summary: All public and private fields are serialized. Members can be excluded using or . This member serialization mode can also be set by marking the class with and setting IgnoreSerializableAttribute on to false.

member.name: M:CodeSmith.Engine.AdoHelper`1.AttachParameters(System.Data.IDbCommand,System.Data.IDataParameter[])
member.summary:
This method is used to attach array of IDataParameters to an IDbCommand.
This method will assign a value of DbNull to any parameter with a direction of InputOutput and a value of null.
This behavior will prevent default values from being used, but this will be the less common case than an intended pure output parameter (derived as InputOutput) where the user provided no input value.
member.param: The command to which the parameters will be added
An array of IDataParameterParameters to be added to command

member.name: M:CodeSmith.Engine.AdoHelper`1.ExecuteDataset(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.IDataParameter[])
member.summary: Execute an IDbCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters.

example.code: DataSet ds = helper.ExecuteDataset(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", new IDbParameter("@prodid", 24));

member.param: A valid connection string for an IDbConnection
The stored procedure name or SQL command
An array of IDbParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: A DataSet containing the resultset generated by the command
member.exception: Thrown if any of the IDataParameters.ParameterNames are null, or if the parameter count does not match the number of values supplied
Thrown if the parameter count does not match the number of values supplied

member.name: M:CodeSmith.Engine.AdoHelper`1.ExecuteDataset(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via an IDbCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.remarks: This method provides no access to output parameters or the stored procedure's return value parameter.
member.param: A valid connection string for an IDbConnection
The name of the stored procedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: A DataSet containing the resultset generated by the command

member.summary: Execute an IDbCommand (that returns a resultset and takes no parameters) against the provided IDbConnection.
member.param: The stored procedure name or SQL command
member.returns: A DataSet containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:CodeSmith.Engine.AdoHelper`1.ExecuteDataset(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.IDataParameter[])
member.summary: Execute an IDbCommand (that returns a resultset) against the specified IDbConnection using the provided parameters.

example.code: DataSet ds = helper.ExecuteDataset(conn, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", new IDataParameter("@prodid", 24));

member.param: The stored procedure name or SQL command
An array of IDataParameters used to execute the command
member.returns: A DataSet containing the resultset generated by the command
member.exception: Thrown if any of the IDataParameters.ParameterNames are null, or if the parameter count does not match the number of values supplied
Thrown if the parameter count does not match the number of values supplied

member.name: M:CodeSmith.Engine.AdoHelper`1.ExecuteDataset(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via an IDbCommand (that returns a resultset) against the specified IDbConnection using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.remarks: This method provides no access to output parameters or the stored procedure's return value parameter.
member.param: The name of the stored procedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: A DataSet containing the resultset generated by the command
member.exception: Thrown if the parameter count does not match the number of values supplied

member.name: M:CodeSmith.Engine.AdoHelper`1.ExecuteDataset(System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: Execute an IDbCommand (that returns a resultset and takes no parameters) against the provided IDbTransaction.
member.param: The stored procedure name or SQL command
member.returns: A DataSet containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:CodeSmith.Engine.AdoHelper`1.ExecuteReader(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.IDataParameter[],CodeSmith.Engine.AdoHelper{`0}.AdoConnectionOwnership)
member.summary: Create and prepare an IDbCommand, and call ExecuteReader with the appropriate CommandBehavior.
member.remarks:
If we created and opened the connection, we want the connection to be closed when the DataReader is closed.
If the caller provided the connection, we want to leave it to them to manage.
member.param: A valid IDbConnection, on which to execute this command
The stored procedure name or SQL command
An array of IDataParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
Indicates whether the connection parameter was provided by the caller, or created by AdoHelper
member.returns: IDataReader containing the results of the command
member.exception: Thrown if any of the IDataParameters.ParameterNames are null, or if the parameter count does not match the number of values supplied
Thrown if the parameter count does not match the number of values supplied
